meanings.definition: A unit used to measure the intensity of a sound or the power level of an electrical signal.
meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the sound using decibels.
meanings.sent2: The concert was so loud that it reached dangerous decibels.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow was amplified to extreme decibels by the megaphone.
meanings.sent4: The decibels of excitement in the stadium were off the charts.
meanings.sent5: The decibels of the thunderstorm made the windows rattle.

meanings.definition: A scale for measuring the loudness of a sound.
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained the concept of decibels to the students.
meanings.sent2: The decibels of the fireworks display were impressive.
meanings.sent3: The baby's cry reached ear-splitting decibels in the quiet library.
meanings.sent4: The decibels of laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The decibels of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
